intro: Impatiens befiananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
